atal care contact, and the newborn should be 
referred for further evaluation if any of the signs is 
present: stopped feeding well, history of convulsions, fast 
breathing (breathing rate of ≥60 per minute), severe 
chest in-drawing, no spontaneous movement, fever 
(temperature ≥37.5 °C), low body temperature 
(temperature <35.5 °C), any jaundice in first 24 hours of 
life, or yellow palms and soles at any age. 
The family should be encouraged to seek health care 
early if they identify any of
